page.title: 20Customs
page.content: {Old}The footbridge over Lowbrook used to be shrouded in fog, people in Norton Lane had to guide travellers by calling them. {Revived}"Beating the Bounds" This is an old custom dating back hundreds of years, in which newly sown crops are blessed and the extremities of the Parish visited.Since maps did not exist in the early times it was customary to beat a somewhat reluctant choirboy at points along the boundary in order that he might remember its location in years to come.The Parish of St. James, Shirley, of which Tidbury Green is a part, revived the custom as part of the 150th anniversary celebrations of the church in a sponsored form. It proved to be such an enjoyable day out that the walk is repeated each Rogation Sunday .
